item.title: Nuvama Wealth Management Ltd Forms Death Cross Signalling Bearish Trend
item.description: Nuvama Wealth Management Ltd has recently formed a Death Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average (DMA) crosses below the 200-DMA, signalling a potential shift towards a bearish trend. This development highlights a deterioration in the stock’s momentum and raises concerns about its medium to long-term outlook amid weakening price action and technical signals. Time: 22 minutes ago

item.title: Felix Industries Ltd Forms Golden Cross, Signalling Potential Bullish Breakout
item.description: Felix Industries Ltd has recently experienced a significant technical event known as the Golden Cross, where its 50-day moving average has crossed above the 200-day moving average. This development is widely regarded as a bullish signal, indicating a potential long-term trend reversal and a shift in momentum that could favour investors seeking growth opportunities in the Miscellaneous sector. Time: 22 minutes ago

item.title: Quarterly Earnings Review: Dec-2025 Results Reveal Mixed Trends Across Market Caps
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has unfolded with a nuanced performance across Indian equities, as 4,075 companies declared results. While the proportion of positive earnings surprises has edged up marginally to 46.0%, the underlying trends reveal a complex interplay of sectoral strengths and market cap dynamics that investors must carefully analyse. Time: 23 minutes ago

item.title: Large-Cap Segment Edges Higher Led by Bank of Baroda; Defensive Stocks Show Mixed Trends
item.description: The large-cap segment, represented by the BSE 100 index, recorded a modest gain of 0.23% on 17 Feb 2026, reflecting a cautious but positive market mood. While heavyweight stocks such as Bank of Baroda led the advance with a robust 3.66% return, some defensive names like Kwality Wall's lagged, declining by 4.98%. The advance-decline ratio of 1.63x, with 62 stocks advancing against 38 declining, underscores a broadly constructive environment amid mixed sectoral trends. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Mid-Cap Segment Surges 0.62% Led by Strong Sectoral Gains and Broad Market Breadth
item.description: The BSE Midcap index advanced by 0.62% on 17 Feb 2026, outperforming broader market segments as select stocks demonstrated robust momentum. Aegis Vopak Term emerged as the top performer with a notable 5.81% return, while Brainbees Solutions lagged with a 4.22% decline. The segment’s breadth remained positive with an advance-decline ratio of 1.48, signalling broad-based participation amid mixed sectoral trends. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Small-Cap Segment Sees Mixed Performance Amid Sectoral Divergence
item.description: The BSE Smallcap index has experienced a modest decline of 0.4% today, extending a recent five-day slide of 2.75%, signalling a cautious mood among investors in the small-cap segment. Despite this, select stocks within the index have delivered notable returns, reflecting a nuanced market environment shaped by sectoral divergences and evolving technical outlooks. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Ind-Agiv Commerce Ltd Falls to 52-Week Low of Rs.66.5 Amidst Weak Fundamentals
item.description: Ind-Agiv Commerce Ltd’s shares declined sharply to a fresh 52-week low of Rs.66.5 on 17 Feb 2026, marking a significant milestone in the stock’s ongoing downward trajectory. This new low reflects persistent pressures on the company’s valuation amid subdued financial performance and challenging market conditions within the Trading & Distributors sector. Time: 2 hours ago
